p: The relationships between clusters, the PCA-Axis1, agriculture, and the surface water were analyzed using cross-correlations ( P = 0.05). The cross-correlations assess the time alignment of two time series by means of the correlation coefficient. The series have been cross-correlated to ascertain the best temporal match and the potential lag between two selected variables. The correlation coefficient was then plotted as a function of the alignment position (fig. S3). Positive and negative correlation coefficients were considered, focusing on the Lag 0 value (with +0.50 and âˆ’0.50 as significant thresholds).
